    Sparse DiSTATIS

    sparseDiSTATIS.Rd

    Performs Sparse DiSTATIS analysis on a cube of distance matrices.

    Usage

    sparseDiSTATIS(
  DATA,
  method = "distance",
  Cmat.is.RV = TRUE,
  masses.Cmat = NULL,
  masses.Splus = NULL,
  sparse.Cmat = FALSE,
  sparse.Splus = TRUE,
  components.Cmat = 0,
  components.Splus = 0,
  init.Cmat = "svd",
  init.Splus = "svd",
  seed = NULL,
  grp.Cmat = NULL,
  grp.Splus = NULL,
  rds.Cmat = rep(1, components.Cmat),
  rds.Splus = rep(1, components.Splus),
  orthogonality.Cmat = "loadings",
  OrthSpace.Cmat = NULL,
  orthogonality.Splus = "loadings",
  OrthSpace.Splus = NULL,
  projPriority.Cmat = "orth",
  projPriority.Splus = "orth",
  itermaxALS.Cmat = 1000,
  itermaxPOCS.Cmat = 1000,
  itermaxALS.Splus = 1000,
  itermaxPOCS.Splus = 1000,
  epsALS.Cmat = 1e-10,
  epsPOCS.Cmat = 1e-10,
  epsALS.Splus = 1e-10,
  epsPOCS.Splus = 1e-10,
  tol = .Machine$double.eps
)

    Arguments

    DATA

    A cube of distance matrices for analysis.

    method

    Method for analysis, either "distance" or "covariance".

    masses.Cmat

    A vector of masses for the rows/columns of the RV matrix; defaults to NULL with all 1s.

    masses.Splus

    A vector of masses for the rows/columns of each table in the cube; defaults to NULL with equal masses of 1/(number of rows).

    sparse.Cmat

    Logical indicating whether to apply sparsity on RV matrix; defaults to FALSE.

    sparse.Splus

    Logical indicating whether to apply sparsity on each table; defaults to TRUE.

    components.Cmat

    Number of components for RV matrix; defaults to 0.

    components.Splus

    Number of components for each table; defaults to 0.

    init.Cmat

    Initialization method for RV matrix; defaults to "svd".

    init.Splus

    Initialization method for each table; defaults to "svd".

    seed

    Seed for random number generation; defaults to NULL.

    grp.Cmat

    Grouping vector for the RV matrix; defaults to NULL.

    grp.Splus

    Grouping vector for each table; defaults to NULL.

    rds.Cmat

    Radii for the RV matrix; defaults to rep(1, components.Cmat).

    rds.Splus

    Radii for each table; defaults to rep(1, components.Splus).

    orthogonality.Cmat

    Type of orthogonality constraint for RV matrix; defaults to "loadings".

    OrthSpace.Cmat

    Orthogonal space for the RV matrix; defaults to NULL.

    orthogonality.Splus

    Type of orthogonality constraint for each table; defaults to "loadings".

    OrthSpace.Splus

    Orthogonal space for each table; defaults to NULL.

    projPriority.Cmat

    Priority of the projection for RV matrix; defaults to "orth".

    projPriority.Splus

    Priority of the projection for each table; defaults to "orth".

    itermaxALS.Cmat

    Maximum number of ALS iterations for RV matrix; defaults to 1000.

    itermaxPOCS.Cmat

    Maximum number of POCS iterations for RV matrix; defaults to 1000.

    itermaxALS.Splus

    Maximum number of ALS iterations for each table; defaults to 1000.

    itermaxPOCS.Splus

    Maximum number of POCS iterations for each table; defaults to 1000.

    epsALS.Cmat

    Convergence criterion for ALS for RV matrix; defaults to 1e-10.

    epsPOCS.Cmat

    Convergence criterion for POCS for RV matrix; defaults to 1e-10.

    epsALS.Splus

    Convergence criterion for ALS for each table; defaults to 1e-10.

    epsPOCS.Splus

    Convergence criterion for POCS for each table; defaults to 1e-10.

    tol

    Tolerance for the convergence criterion; defaults to .Machine$double.eps.

    Value

    Returns an object containing the results of the Sparse DiSTATIS analysis, including results for both the RV matrix and each individual table, along with various parameters and settings used in the analysis.

    Examples

    # Example usage of sparseSTATIS function
# Assuming `X` is a data matrix and `column.design` is the design vector
if (FALSE) result <- sparseDiSTATIS(X = X, column.design = column.design)
